title: Anybody having a constant increased ping in the last few days?
body:
I'm on Comcast if it matters. Starting a few days ago (I forgot when exactly) I've had 90 ping instead of my usual 60ish. I'm just wondering if anybody else has experienced an increased ping? 

Some people have been posting about lag spikes. Not the case here.

replies.body:
Increased latency (ping) usually indicates that there were some routing changes at your ISP that caused your connection to take a longer path to our servers. We can check into this by running a traceroute log, which will provide us with an in-depth look at your network routing. I strongly recommend using the network app [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to grab this log. After loading up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace! After 5 minutes or longer has gone by, export the trace results as *text* and paste them in a reply to me.

Please let me know if you ran into any snags along the way. We'll get this figured out together, friend! :)

It actually looks like your issues start within your home network, where the latency between your PC and modem is **as high as 193ms.** I'd recommend giving your modem/router a quick reboot by unplugging it for 2 minutes. If that didn't cause any changes after running a fresh traceroute, you'll want to reach out to your ISP about this. Providing this traceroute to a tier 2 agent or a supervisor will provide a lot of context and should help them launch an investigation into this.

Hit me up if you have any other questions!
